articles.title: Auto Tariffs Take Effect, Putting Pressure on New Car Prices
articles.description: President Trump says the tariffs will encourage investment in U.S. factories, but analysts say car buyers will have to pay thousands more.
articles.content:
Tariffs on imported vehicles took effect Thursday, a policy that President Trump said would spur investments and jobs in the United States but that analysts say will raise new car prices by thousands of dollars.
The 25 percent duty applies to all car... [509 chars]

articles.title: Trump tariffs see stocks dive and investors scramble to bonds, gold and yen
articles.description: Nasdaq futures tumbled 3.3% and in after-hours trade as $760bn was wiped from the market value of ‘Magnificent Seven’ technology leaders
articles.content:
Stocks dived and investors scrambled to the safety of bonds, gold and the yen on Thursday as Donald Trump unveiled a bigger-than-expected wall of tariffs around the world’s largest economy, upending trade and supply chains.
The technology sector was ... [3149 chars]

articles.title: Trump’s Tariffs Could Reshape the US Tech Industry
articles.description: Apple, Amazon, and other tech companies reliant on global supply chains stand to lose the most from Trump's trade policies, but some software firms expect more demand for their services.
articles.content: Sweeping tariffs unveiled by US President Donald Trump on Wednesday will have ripple effects across the tech industry, according to experts who study global trade. The measures, which include a minimum 10 percent tariff on all countries and steep new... [2865 chars]

articles.title: US stock futures plummet in the wake of Trump's tariffs announcement
articles.description: The reaction to Trump's sweeping tariffs announcement didn't take long to hit the U.S. stock market, with Dow Futures plummeting over 1,000 points by Wednesday evening.
articles.content:
US stock futures plummet in the wake of Trump's tariffs announcement

articles.title: live updates Trump tariffs
articles.description: Wednesday saw further volatility roil markets as tensions ran high ahead of Trump's announcement, but stocks ultimately ended the session in the green.

articles.description: "The Nasdaq peaked on DeepSeek day so that's a Mag 7 problem, not a MAGA problem," Bessent said.

Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent speaks to reporters outside the West Wing after doing a television interview on the North Lawn of the White House on March 13, 2025 in Washington, DC.

articles.title: Trump's Tariff Hikes on China, Vietnam Pose Big Problem For Shoe Firms
articles.description: Trump's reciprocal tariffs of 34 percent on China and 46 percent on Vietnam spell big trouble for shoe brands, with price hikes likely on the horizon.
articles.content:
Sweeping reciprocal tariffs are here, and footwear and fashion firms, as well as retailers, have a huge problem.
On Wednesday, U.S. President Donald J. Trump declared economic war, imposing in general half of the percentage in tariffs that other coun... [9637 chars]

articles.title: Trump’s New Tariffs Test Apple’s Global Supply Chain
articles.description: The iPhone maker spent years trying to move production of some products out of China to avoid tariffs. But now that may not matter.
articles.content:
When President Trump first pushed tariffs on China in 2018, Apple began moving more production of iPads and AirPods to Vietnam and iPhones to India.
But with Mr. Trump’s return to the White House, that strategy may have backfired for the world’s most... [674 chars]

articles.title: Trump tariffs on Vietnam could raise prices for shoes, furniture, toys
articles.description: The country became a popular alternative for furniture, apparel and toymakers trying to avoid the crossfire of U.S. trade tensions with Beijing
